'''Hopper-Loop Pulse Divider'''

2×(3 + pulse count/2)×3

''output pulse:'' 3 ticks

The bottom-right hopper contains a single item.

 | input+rd-ew | SB | rt-w!+SB-u | ho-e+rd-se! | ho-e+rd-sew! | Dr-s+rd-sw! | rc-e | output+rd-ew |-
 | | | rt-n | ho-n+rd-new! | ho-w+rd-new! | ho-w+rd-nw! | |

}}
{{Schematic

 | style = display: inline-block; float: none; vertical-align: text-top;
 | caption =

'''Dropper-Hopper Pulse Divider'''

3×4×2 (24 block volume)<br />flat

''output pulse:'' (4 × pulse count) ticks

The dropper contains a number of items equal to the pulse count. The bottom-left hopper contains a single item.

 | input+rd-ew | Dr-e | ho-w | rt-s! | | |-
 | | rc-s! | rc-s | SB | rd | |-
 | | ho-e | ho-w | rc-e | SB | output+rd-ew

}}
{{Schematic

 | style = display: inline-block; float: none; vertical-align: text-top;
 | caption =

'''Dropper-Dropper Pulse Divider'''

3×6×2 (36 block volume)<br />flat

''output pulse:'' (2 × pulse count) ticks

The left dropper contains a number of items equal to the pulse count. The left hopper contains a single non-stackable item.

 | input+rd-ew | SB | Dr-e | Dr-w | SB | rr-w1 | rd-sw | |-
 | | | rc-s! | rc-s | | rd-se | rd-nw | |-
 | | | ho-e | ho-w | SB | rs-e | SB | output+rd-ew

}}

{{Schematic

 | style = display: inline-block; float: none; vertical-align: text-top;
 | caption =

'''Inverted Binary Divider / Counter (wide)'''

3×5×2 (30 block volume)<br />flat, silent, 3-wide stackable (alternating)

''output pulse:'' 2 off-ticks

This circuit triggers on a 2-tick off-pulse input, and outputs a pulse for every two input pulses. It can be stacked to obtain a divider for any power of 2 (2, 4, 8, 16, etc).

 |              |        |                |              | rd-se! | rd-sw!         | -
 |              | rd-se! | output+rd-sew! | input+rr-e1! | lr-s1  | rd-ns!         | -
 |              | rr-n1  | rr-n2!         |              | SB     | rt-w!          | -
 |              | SB     | rt-w!          |              | rr-s1  | rr-s2!         | -
 | input+rr-e1! | lr-n1  | rd-ns!         |              | rd-ne! | output+rd-new! | -
 |              | rd-ne! | rd-nw!         |              |        |                | -

}}

{{Schematic

 | style = display: inline-block; float: none; vertical-align: text-top;
 | caption =

'''Inverted Binary Divider / Counter (tall)'''

2×5×3 (30 block volume)<br />silent, 2-wide stackable (alternating)

''output pulse:'' 2 off-ticks

This version of the circuit trades height and an extra torch to reduce the circuit width to two blocks for closer stacking, but is otherwise identical to the flat version.

 |              |                |              | rd-ns!+rt-s!   | -
 | rd-se!       | output+rd-sew! | input+rr-e1! | lr-s1+SB-u     | -
 | rr-n2!       | rr-n1          | rt-e!        | SB+rd          | -
 | rt-e!        | SB+rd          | rr-s2!       | rr-s1          | -
 | input+rr-e1! | lr-n1+SB-u     | rd-ne!       | output+rd-new! | -
 |              | rd-ns!+rt-n!   |              |                | -

}}

 | | | rd-ns! | ts+rd-se!+lighter | output+rd-sew!+lighter | input+rr-e1!+lighter | ts+lr-s1+lighter | -

 |input+rd-ew!+P&#x305;+lighter|rc-e!|ts+rd-ew!+lighter|input+rr-e1!+lighter|ts+lr-n1+lighter|ts+rd-ne!+lighter|output+rd-new!+lighter| -
